blog.name: agameoftragedy
blog.title: Blame GRRM
blog.description: I used to be at least 10% more normal before I read those books. Now everything's Theon Greyjoy (and Robb Stark... and Ramsay Bolton) and everything is awful in a wonderful, wonderful way. My main blog is MzyraJ if you want more of me for some reason.

summary: Just read the Bronn vs Vardis Egen chapter in AGOT to my fiancé (the only way he’s gonna read the books is through me it seems),...
body:
Just read the Bronn vs Vardis Egen chapter in AGOT to my fiancé (the only way he’s gonna read the books is through me it seems), and also saw a post of what looked like Sansa looking on knights of the Vale, and it got me thinking…

What if the Vale doesn’t help? For one thing they could be tied up enough with the upgraded mountain clans.

And as to Sansa herself, she looks an awful lot like the Tully sisters. Lysa, who was of dubious judgment and prevented them joining the war when they wanted to (and murdered beloved Jon Arryn, if they ever find out). And Catelyn brought Tyrion Lannister into the Vale, which resulted in the Lannisters arming some of the mountain clans in the first place. And if Robin dies she may be considered complicit in that too (which she is, subconsciously). What is Sansa to them, if for some reason the marriage and image politics don’t work? For them to leave their lands, assuming they know they’re at risk?

Like, Littlefinger’s plan works in theory and maybe it will, but most plans go wrong in this series… 🤔

summary: So a new Maisie Williams quote has been making the rounds and it has people a bit upset. Personally, I don’t really have an...
body:
So a new Maisie Williams quote has been making the rounds and it has people a bit upset. Personally, I don’t really have an issue with it. Sure, the first part of it is a bit on the troll-ish side, but really it’s just her just taking a piss out of the fact that Jon went to get Dragonglass and wound up falling in love with Dany. That was her having a bit of a laugh. However, that doesn’t seem to be what has people in an uproar. It’s rather the second part.

I don’t see what the problem is. I mean, Jon is not always the sharpest tool in the shed. He *does* rush headfirst into situations without always thinking things through. He doesn’t always make the best decisions and that sometimes gets him (and others) into trouble. So Arya–one of the few people he would most likely be willing to listen to–calling him out when he does something stupid–is a good thing. And her teaming up with Sansa to recognize when Jon needs to be called out is *also* a good thing because it means that they are on the same side!

Them not being on the same side was something that upset people last season? And when Arya and Sansa came to an understanding at season’s end it made people happy. And wasn’t that  we wanted to continue definitely happen this season? Yeah. Arya, on the same side as Sansa, calling Jon out on something doesn’t mean that Arya is against Jon. It means that Arya, Sansa *and* Jon are together, on the same side. They are a family, a part of the Stark family who are communicating… calling each out on their dumb shit! Because that’s what family does. This is a GOOD thing!

summary: people didn’t complain about arya’s behavior last season just because she had a different opinion from sansa, they were just...
question: people didn’t complain about arya’s behavior last season just because she had a different opinion from sansa, they were just legit angry that she was saying the fall of their house (which lead to years of sansa being physically and mentally abused) is to blame on her 13 year old sister being stupid and then threatened to kill her??
answer:
And why those people (in which I assume you belong to) only complained about Arya’s behavior and totally overlooked that Sansa belittled Arya’s trauma and while she didn’t theatened to kill her sister was actually planning to, and would have done so if it wasn’t for Bran interfering?

If you claim to equally love the Stark Sisters shouldn’t those people see that both girls did some things wrong the previous season instead of only hating Arya while totally absolving Sansa of any resposibility? 

Because each time Sansa and Arya have an agruement I see those people flooding Arya’s tag calling her degrading names - so much for loving them both. But once a cast member or a spoiler says that Stark sisters will be on better terms/will work together the same people are back on their bullshit “we love equally those two girls”. You know, it would be fairer if they/you just admitted that you only like Arya when she’s in agreement with Sansa. 

At least Arya’s stans don’t pretend to love both girls when they don’t. Honesty is a nice trait.

summary: So what we not about to do is hate on the cast
body:
So what we not about to do is hate on the cast

Leave Emilia, Kit, Maisie, and Sophie the fuck alone. I don’t always agree with their character interpretations but I never hate on them. It’s fine to disgree with them but stop with the fucking hate. Seriously get off their dicks.

Leave Emilia, Kit, Maisie, and Sophie the fuck alone. I don’t always agree with their character interpretations but I never hate on them. It’s fine to disgree with them but stop with the fucking hate. Seriously get off their dicks.

tags: i had more to sy but it got lost in my anger
summary: Sansa Stark is a Queen Since GoT is coming back next month I’ve been seeing a lot of the “unpopular opinions” on twitter about...
body:
Sansa Stark is a Queen

Since GoT is coming back next month I’ve been seeing a lot of the “unpopular opinions” on twitter about my girl Sansa and I’m sick of everyone saying she’s a weak character. 

Sansa is hated for being the exact image of what sociate imposes on females nowadays. She’s femine and delicate. But, aparentelly, in GoT that is bad thing. Well, newsflash, wars are not won only by the yealding of a sword. And she’s proven that in the “Battle of the Bastards”.

Futhermore Sansa character developmente is one of the - if not the one - most impressive in the whole show. She went from her perfect proper world to hell in a matter of days and she adpted to it. She lived with her abusers for years without losing a limb ou being killed because she knew how to play their games. To many, it made her seem weak, but if you really think about it you will see that she has what many character in GoT don’t have, emotional inteligency.

Arya, for exemple, with her impulsive ways would’ve been killed in the first year if she were in Sansa’s place. And no, I’m not hating on Arya. I love her just as much as I love Sansa. 

But the thing is that Sansa is like Cersei. She knows how to play the political game. After all Sansa stayed with Cersei for years. Enough time to observe and learn how to play people.

tags: i am tired of people acting like the north owes dany something
they don’t because the WW arent going to stop at The Neck
the WW are an apocalyptic force
which is why jon should have dug in his heels
jon should have kept reminding them that after the WW were done with the north they were going to come for them
summary: Jon Snow was an elected king of an independent nation. Regardless of his reasons he had no right to give up their independence...
body: Jon Snow was an elected king of an independent nation. Regardless of his reasons he had no right to give up their independence without first getting the approval of his subjects, one of which is his sister Sansa. Before Jon left for Dragonstone the Northerners made their feelings very clear. Jon not heeding their words and bending the knee to another monarch is a betrayal. Period. By accepting the position of king he promised to protect the north AND their interest. One of those interest is Northern Independence. The NL have every right to be angry at Jon. Sansa has every right to be angry at Jon. Arya has every right to be angry at Jon. Even more so if they suspect that his loyalties lie somewhere else because he just so happens to have “feelings” for this new monarch. And before anyone tries to say that Jon and Dany are allies my response is: NO. Jon bent the knee and was forced to give up his title and his nation’s sovereignty. Jon is her SUBJECT not her ally. If he was her ally he would still be KitN. Also, Dany isn’t doing anyone a favor by fighting the AotD. The WW are not a Northern problem, it is a Westeros problem. If anything Jon did Dany and Cersei a solid by warning them.

summary: I don’t know how many times I had to repeat myself in saying that the relationship between Sansa and Arya will not only be at...
body: I don’t know how many times I had to repeat myself in saying that the relationship between Sansa and Arya will not only be at the forefront of the story this season, but that they will handle things as a unit. That they will cover each other’s flaws, respect each other’s qualities and be in sync. Their entire storyline last season was built to bring them to this exact place where they are working together in perfect sync with each other. We are about to get the sun and the moon. The politician and the warrior. The she-wolves of Winterfell. It’s a time for wolves and there’s nothing you can do about it.
